meanings.definition: To use capital letters at the beginning of a word or sentence.
meanings.sent1: When writing a title, remember to start capitalising the main words.
meanings.sent2: She is capitalising the first letter of each sentence in her essay.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept capitalising the 'M' in 'meow' on the keyboard.
meanings.sent4: His bold move of capitalising the first letter set the tone for the entire document.
meanings.sent5: By capitalising the first letter, the sign became more noticeable.

meanings.definition: To provide funding for a business or project.
meanings.sent1: The investors are capitalising the new startup company.
meanings.sent2: The government is capitalising the construction of the new bridge.
meanings.sent3: The generous donation is capitalising the expansion of the local library.
meanings.sent4: By capitalising the project, they ensured its success.
meanings.sent5: Capitalising the business venture was a wise financial decision.

meanings.definition: To take advantage of or profit from something.
meanings.sent1: He is capitalising on the opportunity to showcase his talent.
meanings.sent2: The company is capitalising on the latest trend in technology.
meanings.sent3: The clever entrepreneur is capitalising on the market demand for organic products.
meanings.sent4: By capitalising on his strengths, he excelled in his career.
meanings.sent5: She is capitalising on her experience to advance in her field.
